newsitem.title: KENYA: African ministers cancel Burundi mission.
newsitem.headline: African ministers cancel Burundi mission.

text.p: An African regional ministerial mission to Burundi was cancelled on Wednesday following Burundi military strongman Pierre Buyoya's refusal to open talks with Hutu rebels fighting his army junta, a Kenyan minister said.

Foreign Minister Kalonzo Musyoka told Reuters Burundi's declaration on Monday that it would defy regional leaders who are demanding that the army junta talks to Hutu rebels had jeopardised the mission and the region would now continue with crippling sanctions on Burundi.

"We have called off the mission following consultations. It is not opportune for us to go ahead with the mission. In the meantime the sanctions will continue," Musyoka said by telephone from the Tanzanian capital Dar es Salaam.

The ministerial group appointed at last Saturday's heads of state summit in the northern Tanzanian town of Arusha comprised of foreign ministers from Kenya, Tanzania, Uganda, Rwanda, Cameroon, Zaire and Zambia. It was to assess the junta's commitment to dialogue to end ethnic war.
